list_page_teaser: I often get my friends to answer the questionnaire so I can learn more about them and draw their image.  View this gallery to see the resultant images, and learn about them as well.
description_html:
These are some images of my friends in Denver, drawn with the latest version of the Groja © program.

I will be adding more friends to this page, as I gather their scores and get their ok to add them, so check back soon!

image_list.title: Chantee H.
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in Chantee's spiritual portrait represents her preference for making emotional rather than logical decisions.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in Chantee's spiritual portrait represents her openness and idealism.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.

image_list.title: Laura C
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; preference for ideas over facts.
The Blue in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for seeing the world in terms of ideas more than facts.

The Green in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; preference for logic/reson/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.

The Red in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Feeling: passion; friendliness; compassion; warmth; preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/objective decisions; their preference for making emotional/personal/subjective decisions.
The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for seeing the world in terms of facts more than ideas.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  They demonstrate this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents X's auxiliary personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; preference for ideas over facts.
The Blue in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their preference for seeing the world in terms of ideas more than facts.

The Green in this spiritual portrait represents X's auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.

The Red in this spiritual portrait represents X's auxiliary personality trait, Feeling: passion; friendliness; compassion; warmth; preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/subjective decisions; their preference for making emotional/personal/subjective decisions.
The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents X's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their preference for seeing the world in terms of facts more than ideas.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  They demonstrate this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.title: Veronica M.
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in Veronica's spiritual portrait represents her openness and idealism.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in Veronica's spiritual portrait represents her preference for making emotional decisions.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.
